sources.title: Big Man from the North (1930)
sources.description: Big Man from the North is an American animated short film. It is a Looney Tunes cartoon, featuring Bosko, the first star of the series. It was released in January 1931, although some sources give an unspecified date in 1930. It was, like most Looney Tunes of the time, directed by Hugh Harman and Rudolf Ising; Frank Marsales was the musical director. Watch on RetroFlix.org:Â  https://retroflix.org/big-man-from-the-north-1930/

metadata.Plot: Bosko is a Mountie in the cold, snowy north. His sergeant demands that he get his man: a peg-legged villain wanted dead or alive. Bosko rides his dog sled to the local saloon. He joins Honey in some impromptu music-making. The villain strides in; Bosko timidly tells him he's under arrest. The villain only laughs at him; but Bosko will get the last laugh.
metadata.Actors: Bernard B. Brown, Ken Darby, Rudolf Ising
